meanings.definition: A weather vane in the shape of a dog.
meanings.sent1: The dogvane on top of the barn spins when the wind blows.
meanings.sent2: I saw a beautiful dogvane on the neighbor's house.
meanings.sent3: The dogvane looked like it was chasing its tail in the wind.
meanings.sent4: The dogvane atop the church pointed towards the storm clouds.
meanings.sent5: The shiny dogvane gleamed in the sunlight, attracting everyone's attention.

meanings.definition: A decorative ornament resembling a dog on a ship.
meanings.sent1: The captain proudly displayed the dogvane on the ship's mast.
meanings.sent2: The old ship had a majestic dogvane at its bow.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous sailor joked that the dogvane was the ship's guardian.
meanings.sent4: The dogvane on the ship seemed to watch over the crew like a loyal companion.
meanings.sent5: The intricate details of the dogvane made it a standout feature of the vessel.

meanings.definition: A device used to indicate wind direction on a boat.
meanings.sent1: The sailor adjusted the dogvane to ensure they were sailing in the right direction.
meanings.sent2: The dogvane helped the crew navigate through the rough seas.
meanings.sent3: The captain joked that the dogvane had a better sense of direction than the crew.
meanings.sent4: The dogvane swiveled smoothly, showing the wind's every move.
meanings.sent5: The dogvane creaked softly as it pointed towards the open sea, guiding the sailors home.
